areas.pageTitle: Criminal Defense Lawyer in Minneapolis, MN
areas.metaTitle: Minneapolis Criminal Defense Lawyer | Davis Defense Lawyers
areas.metaDescription: Facing criminal charges in Minneapolis? Davis Defense Lawyers provides experienced, aggressive representation for DUI, assault, domestic violence, drug charges, and more. Call now for a free, confidential case evaluation.
areas.heroImageAlt: Attorney Andrew Davis, Minneapolis criminal defense lawyer
areas.uniqueAngle: If you were arrested in Minneapolis, early action matters—charging decisions and release conditions can move fast. Getting counsel involved early can help protect your record, your job, and your future.

faq.q: What should I do after an arrest in Minneapolis?
faq.a: Don’t discuss the case with police, don’t post about it online, and write down everything you remember while it’s fresh. Then contact a criminal defense lawyer as soon as possible to review the complaint, the evidence, and next steps.

faq.q: Do I need a lawyer if this is my first offense?
faq.a: Yes. Even first-time offenses can carry lasting consequences—probation terms, fines, license consequences, background checks, and immigration or employment issues. A lawyer can look for defenses and push for reduced charges or alternatives.

faq.q: How quickly will I have to go to court?
faq.a: It depends on the charge and how you were released, but court dates can be scheduled quickly. It’s best to get legal guidance before your first appearance so you don’t make a mistake that affects bail, conditions, or the case strategy.

faq.q: Can you help with DUI and license consequences in Minneapolis?
faq.a: Yes. DUI cases often have both criminal court and license/administrative consequences. A defense strategy should consider both so you’re not surprised by suspensions, restrictions, or reinstatement requirements.

faq.q: How much does a Minneapolis criminal defense lawyer cost?
faq.a: Fees depend on the charge, complexity, and how far the case goes. After a quick review of your situation, we can provide clear pricing and options—starting with a free, confidential case evaluation.

contentBlocks.title: Criminal Defense Representation in Minneapolis
contentBlocks.body: If you’ve been arrested or charged in Minneapolis, the stakes are real—your record, your license, your job, and your peace of mind. Davis Defense Lawyers represents people across Minneapolis and the Twin Cities in cases involving DUI/DWI, assault, domestic violence allegations, drug charges, theft, and other criminal matters. We focus on fast action, clear communication, and building a defense strategy that fits the facts of your case—starting with a free, confidential case evaluation.

areas.pageTitle: Criminal Defense Lawyer in St. Paul, MN
areas.metaTitle: St. Paul Criminal Defense Lawyer | Davis Defense Lawyers
areas.metaDescription: Charged with a crime in St. Paul or Ramsey County? Davis Defense Lawyers defends clients facing DUI, assault, domestic violence, drug charges, and more. Call now for a free, confidential case evaluation.
areas.heroImageAlt: Attorney Andrew Davis, St. Paul criminal defense lawyer
areas.uniqueAngle: Criminal charges in St. Paul can move quickly from complaint to court dates and release conditions. The right plan early on can improve outcomes—especially when evidence, witness statements, or body cam footage matters.

faq.q: Should I talk to the police if I’m being investigated in St. Paul?
faq.a: In most situations, no. You can be polite and provide basic identification, but you should not answer questions about the incident without a lawyer. Statements made early are often used later in court.

faq.q: Can charges be reduced or dismissed in Ramsey County?
faq.a: Sometimes, yes—depending on the evidence, witness credibility, prior record, and legal issues such as search and seizure. A defense attorney can identify weaknesses and negotiate or litigate for the best possible outcome.

faq.q: What if there’s a no-contact order or release conditions?
faq.a: Release conditions can affect where you live, who you can talk to, and how you work. A lawyer can help you understand the conditions and may be able to seek modifications when appropriate.

faq.q: Do you handle domestic assault allegations in St. Paul?
faq.a: Yes. Domestic allegations often involve fast-moving decisions and protective orders. We focus on protecting your rights, your record, and your ability to move forward.

faq.q: How do I start a case evaluation?
faq.a: Call or text to speak directly with our team. We’ll review what happened, what you’re facing, and what your next steps should be—confidentially and without pressure.

contentBlocks.title: Defense for Criminal Charges in St. Paul
contentBlocks.body: Being charged with a crime in St. Paul can feel overwhelming. You may be worried about jail, probation, fines, losing your license, or what a conviction could mean for your job and family. Davis Defense Lawyers helps clients in St. Paul and throughout Ramsey County navigate the process, understand their options, and build a strong defense in cases involving DUI/DWI, assault, domestic violence, drug charges, and more.

areas.pageTitle: Criminal Defense Lawyer in Bloomington, MN
areas.metaTitle: Bloomington Criminal Defense Lawyer | Davis Defense Lawyers
areas.metaDescription: Accused of a crime in Bloomington? Davis Defense Lawyers represents clients across Hennepin County in DUI, assault, domestic violence, drug offenses, and more. Call now for a free, confidential case evaluation.
areas.heroImageAlt: Attorney Andrew Davis, Bloomington criminal defense lawyer
areas.uniqueAngle: A Bloomington case can create immediate issues—license consequences, employment concerns, and release conditions. We help clients understand what’s happening, what matters most first, and how to protect their future.

faq.q: What happens after a criminal complaint is filed in Bloomington?
faq.a: After charges are filed, you’ll receive notice of a court date and any release conditions. The case moves through hearings where evidence is reviewed, motions may be filed, and negotiations occur.

faq.q: Can you help if I was arrested for DUI in Bloomington?
faq.a: Yes. DUI cases often involve both criminal court and license consequences. We review the stop, testing, and procedures to look for defenses and to reduce penalties where possible.

faq.q: Will a conviction affect my job or background checks?
faq.a: It can. Many employers and licensing boards run background checks. That’s why it’s critical to pursue outcomes that protect your record when possible, including reductions, stays of adjudication, or dismissals when appropriate.

faq.q: Do I need to show up for court even if I think this is minor?
faq.a: Yes. Missing court can lead to a warrant and new consequences. A lawyer can help you understand your obligations and may be able to appear for some hearings depending on the case.

faq.q: How do I get started with your firm?
faq.a: Call or text for a free, confidential case evaluation. We’ll discuss what happened, what you’re facing, and a clear plan for next steps.

contentBlocks.title: Bloomington Criminal Defense Attorney
contentBlocks.body: If you’re facing criminal charges in Bloomington, you deserve a defense strategy that’s focused, fast, and built around the facts. Davis Defense Lawyers represents clients in Bloomington and throughout Hennepin County for DUI/DWI, assault, domestic violence allegations, drug charges, theft, and other criminal matters. We work to reduce the impact on your life and fight for the best possible outcome—starting with a free, confidential case evaluation.
